Text: The City-State Alliance—

A group of archipelagic city-states located in
the northwesternmost part of the Midgar Kingdom,
in the straits of the Vegalta Empire.

Centered on the trading city Grazheim, the religious
state Orum, the academic city Laugus, and the
Altena Empire, these four islands constitute
a de facto federation of republics.

Their economy has prospered as both a logistical
connection between, and a tourist destination for,
both countries. Orum serves as the backbone of
their political power.

The trading city Grazheim is the core of the
city-state's trade functions and tourist resorts.
It is known as the "City of Happiness."

A resort destination, Grazheim boasts many scenic
locations such as the Tourism District, which also
functions as a trade and logistics hub,

and the Academic District, with its architectural
heritage and ancient ruins,including a site of
the religious state Orum.

The Academic District has a partnership with the
college town Laugus, and is always bustling with
students from both Laugus as well as from the
Midgar Academy of Science.

Hmm... Even though it's just a rough draft, it reads
almost like a tourist guide.

What's the big deal? Novels and news articles may be
different things, but in the end they're just a bunch
of words, right?

True...but there's no point in writing something that
doesn't showcase my unique style.

The individuality of a reporter is almost never
required for information, but in my case, I am
a writer, so I'm something of an exception.

Should I make it more essay-like? Hmm...
Because this is my first article, I'm not sure
what's right...

You know, it's fine to try your best as "Natsume
Kafka", but if you've forgotten our purpose for
coming here, you're missing the point.

...I know. This is just a cover for our covert
research activities.

But even for "Natsume Kafka," the acquisition of fame
is probably the second more important thing for her.

Ugh... Who are you? Acting like some important
cultural figure...
Oh, have you resigned to being an amateur, Shiron?
Hey...! No way!

Even I can think of a melody or two, inspired by this
scenic streetscape!
Hmph!
Hmph!
*sigh* ...
We're not going to get anywhere by arguing.
Yes, I agree.

The sightseeing schedule for the Academic District,
which the newspaper has set for this assignment,
starts the morning after tomorrow, so—
That means...these next two days are...totally free!

I'd like to do some preliminary research,
but basically we're free...to do whatever!
Well now, don't let your hair down!
When have I ever let my hair down?
Hmph!
Hmph!
Heheh...!

We've agreed on something! I wonder if we're
intoxicated by the feeling of being on vacation?
It seems so. Let's have some fun!

I've come along to check in on them, just to be
sure they're alright, but those two...they've
become tourists!

They are doing a good job of blending in, but...
they're going a bit overboard!
No... Maybe that's not it.

Maybe it just means that I've been too strict
regarding the missions and activities of the
Seven Shadows?

If that's the case, it's not hard to see why those
girls are enjoying themselves. It's as if they
are taking a break from my watchful eye.
Maybe I should just let them be.

One of the joys of being alive is living in the
moment...

...that precious feeling of joy gives us the strength
to fight the evils in this world!

At any rate, they're getting along better than I
imagined.

In other words, I was spot on in pairing those two!
Heheh...! My intuition hasn't deceived me yet!
